Hi EdTanous

I am trying to understand, how does this new enum help, anyways only 2 possible values and 
VerifyCertificate redfish property also boolean type, isn't additional logic to convert enum to bool and bool to enum ?

Thank you
it makes it more clear what the boolean means
ok, understand

Need a lot more here.. 
Tested: statement as well.
Agreed.

yeah I need to test this patch.
need little time on this one, will get this updated in a week.
Thank you.

I'd like to see this patch merged (as I believe it will help get other things moving forward), so if there's anything I can do to help, please let me know.

one thing to keep in mind, the auth certificates script in the bmcweb script directory might be a good starting point for setting up certificates quickly.
I went ahead and wrote a commit message, tested, and fixed some minor things.  It should be good to go.

Hi Ed Tonous 
I was out on vacation for few days.
Thank you so much for working on this commit.

looks like as per redfish schema verifyCertificate property can be assumed to be "false" by default...

"property is not supported by the service or specified by the client in the create request, it shall be assumed to be `false`"

There was a long discussion about this on the DMTF redfish github.  The way it's worded, that only applies to if the property is "not supported".  If it's supported then it doesn't define a default.

bmcweb follows the principle of "secure by default", so we should default to true when we support the parameter.
Done
@Ed, Is there a plan in DMTF to update the specification to correctly mention the default value for this property ?
There's a long discussion in the DMTF that you can look at.

I'm happy to continue this discussion elsewhere, but currently our defaults verify SSL;  This patchset is adding a feature, but is keeping the behavior the same as it was in the commit prior, while adding the ability to configure the setting.

We can follow up and continue the DMTF discussion if you think this needs to change, but as far as this patchset is concerned, I suspect it can merge.
Yes. This can merge. DMTF discussion can go as a separate item
